greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,m), n>=0, m>=0, read by antidiagonals: A(n,m) = n-th number of the m-th iteration of the hyperbinomial transform on the sequence of 1's.
comment: See A088956 for the definition of the hyperbinomial transform.
A(n,m), n>=0, m>=0, is the number of subtrees of the complete graph K_{n+m} on n+m vertices containing a given, fixed subtree on m vertices. - _Alex Chin_, Jul 25 2013
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
mathematica: a[_, 0] = 1; a[n_, k_] := Sum[k*(n - j + k)^(n - j - 1)*Binomial[n, j], {j, 0, n}]; Table[a[n - k, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, n, 0, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 24 2013 *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 17 2008, revised Oct 30 2012
